intro: Bothriocline angolensis, commonly known as the Angola thornveld daisies, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers with yellow centers and white to pale blue petals. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. It has hairy stems and leaves, and its flowers bloom in spring and summer. Bothriocline angolensis is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in semi-arid conditions.
